availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Newton S. Cates (Webster County, Ky, farmer and pvt 35th Ky Mtd Inf)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Cates and Frances Cates. Married to Mildred Cates. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 2, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 157A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 623-24.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 3, p. 208B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0413.
"Newton Solomon Cates (1838-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46200473, accessed November 30, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46200473.
